bounties-of-maa/items/auto-bolt-cannon.h.title: Auto Bolt Cannon
bounties-of-maa/items/auto-bolt-cannon.h.description: Effectively a miniature mechanized ballista that can be controlled by a system of leavers no more than 50 feet from the device. The device requires 1 character to take the Aim action but have a maximum of 5 bolts loaded at a time. A new magazine can be loaded with an Action.For personal spelljamming craft, one of these can be mounted on the deck and the controls can be routed to the spelljamming helm on the ship.The magazine auto-loads each of the 5 bolts so the operator doesn't need to take the Load action unless the magazine has run out. Each time a bolt has been fired, the Aim action must be taken before it can be fired again. Aiming and firing required pulling a series of leavers in the correct order. If a player has a Wisdom, Strength, Dexterity, or Intelligence of less than 10, the character must roll a DC 10 ability check (the player can choose any of the above 4 abilities) with proficiency. On a failed save the Aim action has failed, if the character chooses to Aim again on their next turn, it will automatically be successful; if the character chooses any other action it the a new roll is required.

bounties-of-maa/items/circlet-of-concent.title: Circlet of Concentration
bounties-of-maa/items/circlet-of-concent.description: A device that floats a foot above the head of an attuned player which is capable to dividing the "wearer"'s concentration. The device itself is bound to another magical object that requires concentration to control. Once bound the only ways to break that bond would result in the destruction of the Circlet.

bounties-of-maa/locations/aurinkokunta.h.title: Aurinkokunta
bounties-of-maa/locations/aurinkokunta.h.description: Wildspace system home to the Star () and the following planetsMaa

bounties-of-maa/locations/duultha.html.title: Duultha
bounties-of-maa/locations/duultha.html.description: Second largest city in the nation of Kettu, lead by Viceroy Florian Ott

bounties-of-maa/locations/kettu.html.title: Kettu
bounties-of-maa/locations/kettu.html.description:
Palicona
Duultha
Kettu is the closely thing to a continent on Maa covering 200,000 Square miles (about the size of California and Nevada), the "unified" government is seated here in the largest city (Palicona).

bounties-of-maa/locations/maa.html.title: Maa
bounties-of-maa/locations/maa.html.description:
Earth-like planet, most of the land is in the form of large collections of archipelagos though there are a handful of Island Cities that take up larger islands and one large continent called Kettu. Small ships are a huge part of all Maa-ian cultures.
Kettu
Revon

bounties-of-maa/locations/palicona.html.title: Palicona
bounties-of-maa/locations/palicona.html.description: The largest city in Kettu, an international seat of power and the host of the Council of Stewards. 150 sq miles (About the size of denver), the cities is literally built around the building that houses The Council, in a radial pattern with 12 spokes radiating out.

bounties-of-maa/locations/revon.html.title: Revon
bounties-of-maa/locations/revon.html.description:
Eyo
An nation comprised of 125 island archipelago. Officially founded with the signing of the Accords of Revon; a partnership between the native drow tribe the Vontal and the crew of a spelljamming ship that crash landed among the islands.
Historically the unincorporated islands subsided mostly on fish and trade resources from the sea like fish, pearls, ambergris, as well as curious mechanical devices created by the Vontal.
When the Revenant Crew crash landed on Maa, things looked a bit grim but The Vontal banded together to save the lives of the crew. In return the Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel offered to split carcass. Wallace Cartwright saw an opportunity in the deal proposed by Twice, the knowledge of spelljamming and new resource materials in the carcass would be a potent combination; he was right. The signing of the Accords of Revon, established a new nation on the planet Maa as a union between the 25 Giff crew of the Revenant and the 100 or so Vontal.Quickly with the astral knowledge and resources of the Giff combined with the curiosity and craft of the Vontal resulted in a whole trade in semi-magical devices consisting of spelljammer ships, personal water craft and low atmosphere air ships.
Recently an ancient Thri-kreen Professor Tizzik setup a new laboratory with the blessing of the united Revon government and significant investment from the Viceroy Florian Ott the leader of the city-state of Palicona.

bounties-of-maa/misc/council-of-stewards.title: Council of Stewards
bounties-of-maa/misc/council-of-stewards.description:
The international governing body, originally established as a regular meeting of the monarchal leaders of each nation of Maa. When the last King of Kettu died suddenly, the contentions war of succession lasted for nearly a decade, the entire nation was torn apart. When all parties coffers and populations were exhausted to the point of disaster a treaty was finally negotiated in a pure stalemate. The terms of the treaty took another year to finalize due to no clear heir to the throne, instead each of the lordly houses elected an independent Steward. At the passing of each monarchal leader on the planet Maa, instead of attempting succession, each nation instead negotiated a similar treaty as Kettu. At this point there are no true monarch's on Maa, only representatives elected by their regional leaders.The council meets 4 times each year, to decide international affairs. This body determines rules for enforcing safety when navigating the seas of Maa as well as the regulations that enable or impede trade between nations.Failure
TODO

bounties-of-maa/misc/grasshopper-ship.ht.title: Grasshopper Ship
bounties-of-maa/misc/grasshopper-ship.ht.description: A spelljamming ship that can be piloted by a crew of 1 spell caster and hosts an air envelope that could sustain 2 medium sized creatures for 12 hours or 1 for 24 hours. These ships are capable of traveling between worlds in the same Wildspace system Attempting to reach the astral sea would likely result in the loss of the pilot and ship due to the distance needed. Even if the ship was able to make it to the sea, exiting would be even more dangerous without any oxygen.Fly speed: 100ft (24mph), minimum of 50 feet of movement if move action is taken.So far, the testing has largely been on-world travel since the first attempt to travel off planet resulted in the ship being destroyed by a Squid Ship, the test pilot Timmon Fizbang was just fast enough to drop their concentration and trigger a dimension door to return to the laboratory. Failure TODO

bounties-of-maa/npcs/captain-albert-\"tw.title: Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel
bounties-of-maa/npcs/captain-albert-\"tw.description:
Captain of The Revenant and co-founder of the nation of Revon, currently the most senior leader of the nation of Revon. Failure
TODO

bounties-of-maa/npcs/professor-tizzik.ht.title: Professor Tizzik
bounties-of-maa/npcs/professor-tizzik.ht.description:
The Professor has spent hundreds of years in/on the astral sea researching the magic that enables Spelljamming and the people who choose to use Spelljamming to travel across the astral plane.They have recently setup shop on a planet in the Wildspace system named Aurinkokunta on a planet called Maa. The laboratory they've setup in the nation of Revon in the city of Palicona to study the interaction between pocket dimensions and the mass of an object. Their target is to attempt to create larger air envelopes for Spelljamming ships without requiring such large crews.
They recently made a breakthrough in creating a bag of holding that seems to add mass to the holder but the weight of the bag is unchanged. This has lead to the development of Grasshopper Ships which are spelljamming ships that can be piloted by a crew as low as 1 caster in the helm.Failure TODO

bounties-of-maa/npcs/wallace-cartwright..title: Wallace Cartwright
bounties-of-maa/npcs/wallace-cartwright..description: Leader of the Vontal when Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel and The Revenant arrived on Maa.Failure TODO

bounties-of-maa/00.-contents.html.title: 00. Contents
bounties-of-maa/00.-contents.html.description:
Info THIS IS A WORK IN PROGRESS, lots left to do 01. Setup
02. Simulator Mission
03. Recovery Mission

bounties-of-maa/01.-setup.html.title: 01. Setup
bounties-of-maa/01.-setup.html.description:
Professor Tizzik has made a huge breakthrough in their research and is looking for spelljammers to test out an experimental vessel. A call has been sent out to the citizens of Revon to recruit brave souls to embark on an incredible adventure to far away worlds. Characters must have the Spell-casting ability to qualify, (Barbarian, Fighter, or Rogue characters must take a subclass to participate) and no Spelljamming experience is required! Volunteers will be paid 100gp after 4 weeks of participation. All participants in this study will be required to live at the research facility and all meals will be provided.
The very first Grasshopper Ship was test piloted by Timmon Fizbang (assistant to Professor Tizzik). These early test flights were largely terrestrial. Using this rudimentary version, Timmon was able to successfully travel from Palicona to Duultha to retrieve a message for Professor Tizzik which took roughly a 6 hours to complete the round trip, a sea ship would have take a full day just to make one leg of this journey. After this incredibly achievement, the next test flight was to attempt to reach the moon around Maa. Upon exiting the atmosphere, a Squid ship attacked, since the pilot's concentration was occupied by the spelljamming helm, Timmon wasn't able to cast any spells or control the Auto Bolt Cannon to provide any resistance. The squid ship closed in quickly but Timmon was able to cast dimension door before the attack was able to land a final blow.
Professor Tizzik now having some credible and compelling evidence that spelljamming can be made more accessible by shrinking the size of the vessels, went in search of funding to build a second generation of ships. Viceroy Florian Ott was quite impressed with the potential and offered to invest in the research. The manufacture of 5 new ships took the better part of a year, and now the professor is looking for new test pilots, Timmon is understandably rattled by their encounter with the squid ship.
Many folks have attended the informational sessions but so far no one has signed up after learning of the risks. The investment made by Viceroy Florian Ott was with public funds provided by the Council of Stewards's Committee for Innovation in Magic (CIM) and the report for effectiveness of the investment is coming due, which has caused the Viceroy to put some extra pressure on the Professor to find some damn pilots.
Timmon Fizbang has recently been able to bottle a batch of a tonic that operates similar to the spell Revivify but to avoid the expense of a 300gp diamond, they used a much less rare gem and as a result the revivified person is always reset back to level 1. With this batch of tonic, the team has reached an agreement with the morgue of Duultha to feed this tonic to those who have died a heroic death. They have requested only those who have some kind of spellcasting ability to serve as the test pilots.
To address the need for the pilot to be concentrating on steering the spelljamming helm, Professor Tizzik has purchased the materials required to create a handful of Circlets of Concentration to attach to the helm of each Grasshopper Ship. Unfortunately, the materials were stolen in transit.

bounties-of-maa/locations/eyo.html.title: Eyo
bounties-of-maa/locations/eyo.html.description:
Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel
Professor Tizzik
Timmon Fizbang
Wallace Cartwright
Lieutenant Horace "Needle" Pineye
Geraldine Cartwright
Seat of power for the nation of Revon, an island city about 50 square miles in total (about the size of Minneapolis).
Faerie fire lit floating carriages zoom over monsoon wet roads. A dark and dreary city, it is artificially darkened by spell work to accommodate the native tribe of drow the Vontal.Since its founding with the

bounties-of-maa/npcs/geraldine-cartwrigh.title: Geraldine Cartwright
bounties-of-maa/npcs/geraldine-cartwrigh.description:
Second in command of the Vontal; now Minister of Education of the Revon. Spouse of Wallace Cartwright.Failure

bounties-of-maa/npcs/lieutenant-horace-\.description: Second in command of the Revenant Crew; now Vice Herald of Revon.Failure TODO

bounties-of-maa/societies/revenant-crew..title: Revenant Crew
bounties-of-maa/societies/revenant-crew..description:
Captain Albert "Twice" Mossrel
Lieutenant Horace "Needle" Pineye
The first group of spelljammers to visit the wildspace were the crew of The Revenant who were hunting Astroid spiders. They found a particularly large one in the wildspace system Aurinkokunta. In the process of killing their found target the ship was badly damage. The crew managed to safely land the ship with their carcass in tow on the planet Maa among a chain of sparsely populated islands.Failure TODO All members of the crew are Giff

bounties-of-maa/societies/vontal.html.title: Vontal
bounties-of-maa/societies/vontal.html.description:
Wallace Cartwright
Geraldine Cartwright
The native people of these islands are a drow tribe called the Vontal. The Vontal were a small and sparse population, most homes have a shrine to both Oghma, god of knowledge and Gond, god of craft; inventors are the most revered of their population.Failure TODO

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
